29.Name: Havoc Bane
29.Desc: Utilizes Havoc Bane for combat advantage

Name: Chisa
Desc:
"Just an ordinary student."

Calmly, she introduces herself, a faint iridescent shimmer flickering in her eyes. Again, the structures of the world reveal themselves in her vision. Narrowing her eyes, she singles out the very thread that tugs at life itself.

CharaInfo.Info:
"Just an ordinary student."

Calmly, she introduces herself, a faint iridescent shimmer flickering in her eyes. Again, the structures of the world reveal themselves in her vision. Narrowing her eyes, she singles out the very thread that tugs at life itself.
CharaInfo.TalentDoc:
>>>Authorization confirmed. Associated files unlocked. Welcome, Inspector ███>>>

Forte Examination Report: NHA-Eye of Unraveling-017

Subject: Chisa Kuchiba

Resonator Type: Mutant

Tacet Mark Location: Right upper arm

Testing Agency: <te href=851074>Ashinohara</te> - Neo Honami - Resonator Monitoring Center

Testing indicates the subject possesses an extraordinary cognitive ability to intuitively discern the structure, form, and movement of observed objects. While employing her Forte, she can analyze objects' weaknesses through her vision and apply precise interference to induce structural destruction.

Notes: Subject recounts perceiving "threads" that cause objects to unravel. Preliminary analysis suggests these "threads" are not actual entities but visual manifestations exclusive to her vision.
CharaInfo.TalentCertification:
>>>Access Level Upgrade: R-III>>>

The subject's Forte exhibits extensibility and growth potential beyond safety thresholds. Under extreme conditions, she may be capable of analyzing abstract spatial structures, identifying the "threads" of anomalies within anomalous spaces, and inducing reality-distortion events, including spatial ██.

Current Anomalous Indicators:
- Multiple steep fluctuations detected in her <te href=850067>Rabelle's Curve</te>, with peak values approaching the critical limit.
 
- Forte stability remains weak, presenting a measurable risk of <te href=850073>Overclocking</te>.
 
Preliminary Monitoring Measures:
The subject is required to wear a collar-type Resonator suppression device to regulate her Forte and is placed on the observation list of high-risk Resonators.
 
Relevant monitoring agencies are instructed to maintain updated records with central authorities regarding the subject's Forte changes and real-time location. If deemed necessary, compulsory measures may be taken in accordance with the law.

Stories.Title: The Summer Where the Story Began
Stories.Content:
She spent her six-year-old summer riding on her father's shoulders.

The night breeze carried the mingled scents of fireworks and grilled squid from the festival stalls. With a marshmallow stick in one hand, little Chisa pointed toward the sky with the other. Goldfish-shaped lanterns swayed in the breeze, and fireworks blossomed overhead. She saw red threads tied to people's wrists stretching and intertwining, weaving into a warm, invisible web that softly enveloped the festival crowd.

"What wish did you just make, Chisa?" her mother asked, the fireworks reflected tenderly in her eyes. Chisa's cheeks were sticky with apple syrup as she puffed them out and proudly declared, "I want to be like Mom! To make the prettiest paper cuttings so I can keep every precious, happy thing—"

Her twelve-year-old summer was different. That year, her world fell into silence all of a sudden.

Her father was away on endless business trips, and the refrigerator door was plastered with her mother's shift schedules. Over time, she grew used to the cold beeps that greeted her at the other end of the line.

"It's okay. I can take care of myself," little Chisa whispered to herself. With such resolution, she lifted the pot lid and decided to make herself a lemon-scented sukiyaki hotpot. The prepared meal package on the table read in bold print: a healing dish for a family gathering.

The broth began to bubble, filling the room with the rich scent of beef and vegetables. Steam fogged the windows. Turning her face to the misted glass, Chisa saw only her own faint, lonely reflection. No laughter, no clink of glasses.

"For a family gathering."

Such a gentle phrase, she thought, and yet so very far away.

Stories.Title: The Long Rainy Season
Stories.Content:
Her fifteenth summer smelled of pencil shavings and loneliness.

One afternoon, the ceaseless rain of the tsuyu season briefly relented. Carrying a stack of books to return, Chisa crossed the courtyard and passed the equipment room. From behind the door came muffled sobs. Through the narrow gap, she glimpsed her classmate Ritsuko cornered by three girls, her shirt blotched with ink, her eyeglasses shattered on the floor. The head of them pressed a lighter to the embroidered name on her uniform, filling the air with the bitter stench of scorched fabric.

It reminded Chisa of the frog in biology class, pinned flat to the dissection tray, limbs splayed, yet its heart still beating futilely. Before she could think, her hand had already acted. She pushed the ajar door open and drew out the scissors she always carried.

That small pair of scissors had been her mother's faithful companion throughout her career and was passed down to her. Now, it pointed at someone's face for the first time.

"Let her go," she demanded.

Retribution came swiftly. By the next morning, her desk was carved with "idiot." Her locker overflowed with shredded textbooks. But the worst part of it was the blurred faces—no sooner than when she tried to see who had tripped her did she realize every face around her had melted into smears of color. The doctor's report read "psychogenic visual recognition disorder." In the wake of her awakened Forte, her brain had cut loose the thread that allowed her to recognize faces.

In that moment, she heard a faint snap—not the brittle break of nerves, but like the sound she heard when the strings of her goldfish lantern snagged on a tree during a festival years ago. The warm, vibrant threads that once bound people together unraveled, falling away in a rain of broken fragments.

When her scissors shredded the final note filled with malicious words, rain hammered the classroom windows. Chisa stared at her hazy, flickering reflection on the window and suddenly realized that growing up meant learning to cut out every loose thread herself—lantern strings tangled in branches, the kite string unwinding between her and her parents, or the cruel arcs frozen on her bullies' lips.

The rainy season stretched on. Cicadas rose with the mounting summer heat. Clutching her scissors, Chisa began to imagine a path she could carve on her own: a path perhaps lonely, but true to her heart. The one she would never need to turn back from.

Stories.Title: Blurred Features
Stories.Content:
In her sixteenth summer, dark clouds stretched endlessly, and rain came pouring down. Thunder weighed against her eardrums as she stood before the floor-to-ceiling windows of the Resonator Monitoring Center.

"Did you hear me?" The voice was sharp with discontent. Chisa lifted her gaze, only to find the speaker's features dissolving into nothingness.

"Loud and clear," she replied to the void.

The collar clicked shut around her neck, bearing the cold touch of surveillance equipment.

When the storm finally subsided, she set out for home. Cutting through the park, she came upon a boy crying beside a slide, clutching a snapped kite string. In her vision, the kite caught in the treetop stood out with uncanny clarity: three branches formed a natural lock, and if the far-right one was severed—

"Hold there," she stopped the boy from tugging the string. His eyes widened. With a soft snap, the branch split, and the kite drifted down, alighting gently in his arms.

"Thank y—" His cheer broke off at a shrill cry. "M-monster! Stay away from my child!"

Following the woman's terrified gaze, Chisa then became conscious again of the collar biting cold against her throat.

It wasn't a big deal. She told herself she should be used to this by now.

She could see the kite's frame, the trajectories of raindrops, or even the currents of electrons surging through the storm clouds with such clarity, but she could never see through others' faces or their hearts.

She turned and was about to step into the rain, but a small tug caught her sleeve. The boy had wriggled free from his mother's grasp. He pressed a packet of star-shaped candies into her palm. "Here. This is for you! My teacher says only the brave get star candy, so…"

The plastic wrapper crackled faintly in her hand. Chisa stared at the boy. His face was still a blur, yet it glowed, like fireflies circling lanterns in a festival long ago.

"Mom says people with these collars are bad," He leaned closer, whispering. "But I don't believe her. The way you cut that branch? It was so cool."

Chisa paused, then crouched to pat his head. 

The device against her throat stayed still. Her Resonance Spectrum was showing a rare, steady curve. Like a summer sky after the storm, a hint of light finally broke through.

Stories.Title: Nighmare of the Second Month
Stories.Content:
"...!"

Chisa jolted awake from the nightmare, cold sweat soaking her back. In a daze, her side still throbbed with a sharp, phantom pain that clawed at her nerves.

But her flesh was unbroken, unlike in the dream. Drawing a deep breath, she pressed a hand to her chest, trying to calm the frantic pounding of her heart.

It had been two months since she was trapped in Honami. Her body was slowly adjusting to the endless loop day after day, but each night the nightmares dragged her soul deeper into the abyss.

She turned her head toward the sofa. Sumika lay fast asleep, one hand slipping from the cushion, the other resting beside an open notebook scrawled with numbers and scribbled notes.

Outside, the rain fell in relentless torrents.

By the time Sumika woke up, dusk had already descended. The storm had weakened. Faint stars dotted the ink-blue sky, like silver nails scattered carelessly across the cold night. Still yawning, she followed Chisa into a convenience store. While Chisa carefully gathered food and supplies from the shelves, she turned to find Sumika absorbed in the flickering sign overhead, notebook and pen already in hand.

"Chisa, look at this—" she whispered, voice brimming with restrained excitement. "It's just the same as last time! The time, the flicker rate... Everything matches! If we can just gather a few more samples... these data will let us uncover the pattern behind the loop!"

Catching the brightness in her eyes, Chisa unconsciously clenched her fists. In her palm lingered the sensation of yesterday's cut when she severed the Tacet Discords' threads, a cold shiver, like the snapping of silk.

Whenever she drew her scissors and used her Forte, crimson lines surfaced in her vision—the threads of life, visible only to her. Unlike the warmth of human veins, these threads reeked of decay. They pursued the Left Behind, tearing them apart and dragging those fragile lives into yet another loop alongside the Lament.

Chisa studied her reflection on the window: a face calm, almost pale, but with a single ember still burning in her eyes.

Yesterday, here in this very store, she had crossed paths with the same girl again. The one she met every loop, who always shared her snacks so earnestly, never once realizing that she bore the iridescent glow of the Left Behind. Perhaps it was that fragile but unyielding kindness that kept Chisa from accepting that this city had been forever imprisoned in the past.

The night stretched long, but dawn would always come.

When the first light finally broke through the leaden clouds, she thought she could hear the trembling hum of threads. Pressing her hand to her chest, Chisa knew that when the next loop began, everything would reset once again.

But that was fine.

As long as the scissors remained in her grasp, as long as the fragments of warmth had not been completely forgotten...

She would keep walking forward until the day she could finally cut through the nightmare and sever the snare.

Stories.Title: Beyond the Summer's End
Stories.Content:
In the afternoon, a drizzle pattered against the window.

Chisa stood by the floor-to-ceiling window of the Spacetrek Archive. At eighteen, she finally had the leisure to listen to the rhythm of the rain—not the monotonous cadence of Honami's looping rains, but the natural raindrops of Lahai-Roi. Fresh, alive, tinged with a faint sweetness in the air. It was the kind of rain that would casually soak a school uniform left drying on a balcony, or drench an unsuspecting student on the way home.

Steam curled gently from the coffee on her table. With her scissors, she unpacked a bag of sugar... Yes, she still carried them everywhere, though now they were used more for pruning potted plants or opening parcels. The sugar dissolved into the dark surface of the cup. Beyond the window, a few students in bright yellow raincoats splashed through puddles. Their vivid color pierced the gray veil of drizzle, stirring memories of days spent facing endless loops and relentless beginnings—of someone who once walked beside her to the destination of the endless loop, cutting a path through the long night; and of someone who chose to tread countless false paths alone, turning herself into a cornerstone of truth.

When the rain eased, Chisa stepped out of the Archive with a book in her arms. The damp evening breeze lifted her freshly cut hair. The campus stretched before her, alive with the soft after-rain glow. A group of students from the Department of Engineering was engaged in a heated debate over a hovering device. Someone noticed her through the thinning mist, waved brightly, and called her to join—

She watched these young, fervent souls, companions beneath the same sky, all bound for the same sea of stars. And she realized, with striking clarity, that she was no longer a wanderer lost in an endless loop. Her life, after a period of stagnation, had already rejoined the rushing river that carried everyone forward.

She had truly left that endless summer behind.

Taking a steady step, she walked toward her new future.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: I
Voices.Content: This nickel-plated pair of scissors weighs about 152 grams. Its max opening angle is roughly 60 degrees. Just enough to cut through thick wool, even with quilted fleece hidden in the seam. I've always been able to estimate numbers like that, even as a little girl. But after that strange and terrifying power descended upon me, I started seeing more. Now, even a single inch feels like an entire world.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: II
Voices.Content: When I was little, I'd sit on the porch of our house, listening to cicadas while cutting colored paper into goldfish and lucky stars. My mother would be nearby, stitching a yukata. The electric fan creaked as it turned, and slow midday dramas played on the TV... Now that I think about it, summers like that were kind of a luxury.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: III
Voices.Content: In Honami, summer never ends. But there are no cicadas. No evening wind chimes. Only the endless loop of the Lament... Sometimes, I find old boxes of sugar candy in abandoned convenience stores. Normally, living beings shouldn't feel hunger inside a Sonoro Sphere. But that sugary taste always brings back memories of festivals back home, candy in hand... Sorry, I guess none of that really matters.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: IV
Voices.Content: I... I'm not good with faces. When I was little, people always said I got stuck on the details. But ever since faces started blurring in front of me, I've had to rely on that instead. In this Sonoro, "death" is only temporary. Those who disappear always show up again like nothing happened. So I take notes. The grease stain on the shopkeeper's sleeve across the road. The shape of the clerk's hair clip in the convenience store. That way, even if their faces are a blur, I still know who they are.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: V
Voices.Content:
Since grade school, I was what people called a "straight-A student." Steady grades. Perfect attendance. Neat handwriting. Homework always early. Not a single crease in my textbooks. For most people, that's enough... and I don't mind that. People have always trusted me for those reasons, without ever really knowing me. But with you, it's different. You didn't come to me because you saw "I was performing well." You didn't stay because I seemed "reliable." 
We've stood together on the edge of this city's collapse, again and again.  That's why I wanted to say this. Like you said... we're partners. So of course I trust you, too.

Voices.Title: Chisa's Hobby
Voices.Content: Handcrafting, tailoring, plus... mathematics. Yes, I'd say I'm quite good at these.

Voices.Title: Chisa's Trouble
Voices.Content: It's probably my lack of facial expressions. A lot of people think I'm "difficult to approach." It's not that I dislike anyone. I just don't know... how to approach people in a natural way.

Voices.Title: Favorite Food
Voices.Content:
Chocolate bars... A former classmate gave me one once and said something like, "Keep frowning like that and your blood sugar's gonna crash." Didn't really get the science behind it. But after trying one... I started keeping a few boxes on hand. They're good for a quick energy boost, and they keep my head clear. That's the main reason I have them.
...But I do have to admit that chocolate is better than strawberry.

Voices.Title: Disliked Food
Voices.Content: Spicy food. I tasted some <te href=850093>Huanglong</te> cuisines while I was at the Black Shores, and they were... unique. It was the first time I was annoyed by my lack of tolerance for spice. But maybe this could change with enough practice? I'll have to try more.

Voices.Title: Ideals
Voices.Content: ...I don't have any grand ideals. I just know that if I see something happening, I can't pretend I didn't. If my abilities can help, even a little, then I'll keep using them.

Voices.Title: Chat: I
Voices.Content: These small scissors I carry with me were a present from my mother. She used them her entire career as a seamstress. Later, I used them to alter my new school uniform I wore to orientation. It didn't quite fit, so I adjusted it myself. They feel like an invisible thread my parents stitched into me. Silent, yet always pulling me forward.

Voices.Title: Chat: II
Voices.Content: The day they put this collar on me, it happened to rain in my hometown. I watched the downpour and rolling stormclouds through the window, and oddly enough, I felt a sense of relief. My Resonance Ability had been restrained. And I told myself, "Now they won't hate you anymore."

Voices.Title: About Sumika
Voices.Content: Sumika was the first to uncover the "loop pattern" of the <te href=850077>Sonoro</te>. We used to pull all-nighters at the safe house, crunching data. I needed coffee to stay focused, but she always stayed sharp. Honestly, even borderline manic. But I knew how deeply she wanted to understand the truth behind the city's Lament. Maybe that's just the nature of a true researcher. Like she said, even the most dangerous equation still needs someone willing to solve it.

Voices.Title: About Namipon
Voices.Content: Born of love. Always kind and dependable... That's the Guardian of Honami City. Or at least, that's how it likes to introduce itself. Being around Namipon feels peaceful. Hard to explain. Sometimes it follows me, quietly. I won't notice until it brushes up against me, soft fur against my arm, asking if I want coffee. But there's something more beneath that face. Something vast. Maybe it's just... trying to return the love people once gave it.

Voices.Title: About Buling
Voices.Content: She's a very fascinating Taoist. If I remember correctly, she's from <te href=850154>Mengzhou</te>, in <te href=850093>Huanglong</te>? She's always saying odd metaphors and local sayings, and showing off the rare antiques she carries around. Once even offered me a "Buy two, get 20% off" deal. Maybe... I'll take her up on it. Just to see.

Voices.Title: About Shorekeeper
Voices.Content: Shorekeeper helped me a lot while I've been recovering at <te href=850109>the Black Shores</te>. It took me a while to settle in, but in time, I started to feel the kindness there. Shorekeeper once took me to the beach at the Haven of Sprouts to see the stars. They were infinite. And I found myself thinking... Sumika must've stood beneath that same sky many times, imagining the future she hoped to reach.

Voices.Title: Birthday Wishes
Voices.Content:
A birthday... isn't just the anniversary of your birth. It's also a reminder that you're still here. For me, that alone makes it important.
So... please continue to stay healthy, level-headed, endlessly capable, and someone others can count on. May each of your days pass smoothly, and may there always be someone walking alongside you.
—That's the most concise and practical birthday wish I could come up with.

Voices.Title: Idle: I
Voices.Content: Hmm… That's not it. It's this one.

Voices.Title: Self-Introduction
Voices.Content: Kuchiba Chisa. Tactical Development Program, Department of Engineering, Startorch Academy. Forte Specialization: structural dissection... Apologies, this might not be the time for formalities.

Voices.Title: Ascension: I
Voices.Content: ...The threads. I see them more clearly now.

Voices.Title: Ascension: II
Voices.Content: The structure is more complex, but also... more distinctly identifiable.

Voices.Title: Ascension: III
Voices.Content: My Resonance energy continues to expand... Don't worry, I can control it.

Voices.Title: Ascension: IV
Voices.Content: This wasn't by chance, nor was it coincidental. The deadlock has cracked. We'll fight alongside each other... just like before.

Voices.Title: Ascension: V
Voices.Content: No matter where this leads… This battle, I'm all in.

Voices.Title: Injured: II
Voices.Content: There's still time… before the threads snap.

Voices.Title: Fallen: II
Voices.Content: Is this as far as I go…?

Voices.Title: Echo Transform
Voices.Content: In the blink of an eye.

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: III
Voices.Content: New supplies… This'll last us a few more days.

Goods.Title: Old-Style Scissors
Goods.Content:
A pair of scissors with a vintage design. Once a common sight in every market decades ago, they have since slipped quietly into obscurity.

They once trimmed loose threads from a school uniform. They had sliced through the ribbon of a birthday gift. Fate has a habit of hiding its foreshadowing in the smallest of gestures. With each opening and closing, they marked countless endings and beginnings in her life—snipping threads, ribbons, structures, and loops alike.

Every cut was never truly an end, but a quiet herald of something new.

Goods.Title: Red Hair Ribbon
Goods.Content:
Some say a red thread brings protection. Others believe it wards off evil. But in older tales, it is said to bind people with the inescapable pull of fate.

An unseen bond, tied to fate, has quietly linked her to others and to some unknown future with irresistible strength. 

From that moment on, no matter how long or lonely the journey, she continues forward with the echo of companionship.

Goods.Title: Protective Charm
Goods.Content:
She still remembers that day. The rain had just lifted, leaving the sky a flawless blue. Her parents held her hands as they rang the shrine's bell rope together. Amidst the lingering chime, her mother fastened a small protective charm to her wrist.

"It will always protect you, Chisa."

The little Chisa shook her wrist, watching the tassel sway in the breeze, as though answering a vow she was too young to understand.

"No matter how far you go, no matter when, we'll always be here, waiting for you to come home."

SpecialCook.Name: Lemon-Scented Sukiyaki
SpecialCook.Desc: Increases Echo drop rate by 22%, lasting for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode

Skill.Name: Reign of Silence
Skill.Desc:
<size=40><color=Title>Basic Attack</color></size>
Perform up to 2 consecutive attacks, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting <color=Highlight>Basic Attack Stage 2</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Rending Lunge</color>. 
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Rending Lunge</color></size>
Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill on the ground to cast <color=Highlight>Death Snip</color>.
Use <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill in mid-air to cast <color=Highlight>Hanging Finality</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Death Snip</color></size>
Open the scissors, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. After a while, the scissors snip, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> and restoring HP for all nearby Resonators in the team.
Use <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> during this skill to deal additional <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. Use <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> again to immediately snip the target.
The skill DMG is considered <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation DMG</color>.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting <color=Highlight>Death Snip</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Thread Withdrawn</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Thread Withdrawn</color></size>
Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. 
Can trigger successful Dodges within a certain time after being cast.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack</color></size>
Leap into the air and consume STA to attack the target, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.
This skill cannot be cast while in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>.
Perform the following actions within a certain time after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Hanging Finality</color>:
- {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color>;
- Cast <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Glide</color> and {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> before landing.
Hold <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> before landing after casting <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack - Severed Facet</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Mid-air Attack</color></size>
Consume STA to perform Plunging Attack, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. 
While not in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> within a certain time after casting Mid-air Attack to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack Stage 2</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Heavy Attack - Severed Facet</color></size>
Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. 
Use <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> within a certain time after casting <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack - Severed Facet</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Hanging Finality</color>.
If interrupted, <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack - Severed Facet</color> can be cast again by holding <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> before landing. This effect can be triggered once only before landing.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Hanging Finality</color></size>
Consume STA to perform Plunging Attack, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. 
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill on the ground to cast <color=Highlight>Death Snip</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Dodge Counter</color></size>
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> right after a successful <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> to attack the target, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Rending Lunge</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Dodge Counter - Eye of Unraveling: Retraction</color></size>
Hold <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> after a successful <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> on the ground to cast <color=Highlight>Dodge Counter - Eye of Unraveling: Retraction</color> to attack and Stagnate the target, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.
- While not in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, after casting this skill, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> on the ground or use <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> in mid-air to cast <color=Highlight>Rending Lunge</color>. This effect is removed when Chisa enters <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>.
- While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3</color>.

This effect is removed when Chisa enters <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>.
- While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color> and on the ground, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2</color>.

<size=40><color=Title>Serrated Loop</color></size>
While on the ground and <color=Highlight><te href=150803>Ring of Chainsaw</te></color> is full, <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> is replaced with <color=Highlight>Serrated Loop</color>.
Stagnate targets, and deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> and pull in nearby targets.
Casting this skill sends Chisa into <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color> and replaces <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> with <color=Highlight>Eye of Unraveling</color>.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2</color>.
Hold <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> while casting this skill to continuously attack and pull in nearby targets. Release the <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> button in the duration or keep holding it for a certain period of time to cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 1</color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Skill</color></size>
Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> and <color=Highlight>mark</color> the targets.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Enhanced Resonance Skill</color></size>
When <color=Highlight>Forte Gauge</color> is full, <color=Highlight>Enhanced Resonance Skill</color> becomes available. 
Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> and <color=Highlight>mark</color> the targets.
Casting this skill sends Chisa into <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Mark</color></size>
When <color=Highlight>marked</color> targets take damage, Chisa inflicts <color=Highlight>Havoc Bane</color> on them.

Skill.Name: Moment of Nihility
Skill.Desc:
Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> and recover HP for all nearby Resonators in the team. 
Casting this skill sends Chisa into <color=Highlight><te href=150805>Woven Myriad - Convergence</te></color> for {0}s.
While not in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack Stage 2</color>.
Can be cast in mid-air close to the ground.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Woven Myriad - Convergence</color></size>
The DMG Multipliers of <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color>, <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color>, and <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color> are increased by {1}.
The bonus DMG Multiplier for <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color> granted by <color=Highlight>Sawring- Blitz</color> and <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> when <color=Highlight><te href=150803>Ring of Chainsaw</te></color> is consumed additionally increases by {2}.
Casting <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color> ends <color=Highlight>Woven Myriad - Convergence</color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Resonance Liberation</color></size>
Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> and recover HP for all nearby Resonators in the team. 
Casting this skill sends Chisa into <color=Highlight>Enhanced Chainsaw Mode</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Enhanced Chainsaw Mode</color></size>
The DMG Multipliers of <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode Basic Attack</color> and <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode Finisher Attack</color> are significantly increased.

Skill.Name: Inescapable Fate
Skill.Desc: When a Resonator in the team defeats a target marked by <color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color>, the Cooldown of Chisa's Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Eye of Unraveling</color> is reset, triggered up to once every {0}s.
Skill.SimpleDesc: When a Resonator in the team defeats a <color=Highlight>marked</color> target, Chisa's <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color> Cooldown is reset.

Skill.Name: All Ends Here
Skill.Desc:
Casting Intro Skill <color=Highlight>Reverberance - Return</color> or Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Moment of Nihility</color> grants {0} Havoc DMG Bonus and {1} Healing Bonus for {2}s.
When Resonators in the team with <color=Highlight><te href=150802>Thread of Bane</te></color> defeat a target marked by <color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color>, Chisa gains Sight of Unraveling, lasting {3}s.
While in Sight of Unraveling, Chisa inflicts <color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color> that lasts for {4}s on the targets damaged by Resonators in the team with <color=Highlight><te href=150802>Thread of Bane</te></color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
Casting <color=Highlight>Intro Skill</color> or <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation</color> grants Havoc DMG Bonus and Healing Bonus.
When Resonators in the team with <color=Highlight>Thread of Bane</color> defeat a <color=Highlight>marked</color> target, Chisa gains Sight of Unraveling.
While in Sight of Unraveling, Chisa inflicts <color=Highlight>Unseen Snare</color> on the targets damaged by Resonators in the team with <color=Highlight>Thread of Bane</color>.

Skill.Name: Reverberance - Return
Skill.Desc:
Attack the target, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.
While not in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack Stage 2</color>.
While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, use <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2</color>.

Skill.Name: Sight of Unraveling - Oblivion
Skill.Desc:
<size=40><color=Title>Unseen Snare</color></size>
Chisa inflicts <color=Highlight>Unseen Snare</color> on the target for {0}s in the following 4 ways:
- Hitting a target with <color=Highlight>Resonance Skill</color>.
- Hitting a target within a certain period of time after casting <color=Highlight>Serrated Loop</color>.
- Hitting a target with <color=Highlight>Dodge Counter - Eye of Unraveling: Retraction</color>.
- <color=Highlight>Locking</color> on to a target.
When targets marked by <color=Highlight>Unseen Snare</color> take direct damage from Resonators, Chisa inflicts <SapTag=1>{1}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=stack P=stacks SapTag=1} of <color=Highlight><te href=850012>Havoc Bane</te></color> on them. This effect can be triggered up to once every {2}s.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Thread of Bane</color></size>
When dealing damage to targets affected by <color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color>, ignore {4} of their DEF.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Chainsaw Mode</color></size>
While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, Chisa unlocks <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color>, <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color>, <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color>.
<color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color> and <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> consume <color=Highlight><te href=150803>Ring of Chainsaw</te></color> on hit.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Sawring - Blitz</color></size>
<color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color> chains up to 3 consecutive attacks, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.  
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> to start the combo from <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 1</color>. Hold <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> to start from <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2</color>.
Hold <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> while casting <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2</color> to continuously attack the target. <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2</color> is automatically followed by <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3</color>.
While casting <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2</color>, release the <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> button or <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> without directional input to automatically cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2: Discordance</color>, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. Shortly after casting <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2: Discordance</color>, successful Dodges can be triggered.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> shortly after casting <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2: Discordance</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3</color>.
While casting <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3</color>, hold <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> to continuously attack the target. <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3</color> is automatically followed by <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color>.
Release <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> during <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3</color> to automatically cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3: Falltone</color>, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.
<color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color> DMG is considered <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation DMG</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color></size>
While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> following a successful <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color>, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>.
{Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> following <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3</color>.
Hold <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> while casting <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> to sustain the attack. When <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> ends, cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3</color> automatically.
Release the <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> button or <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> without directional input while casting <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 2: Discordance</color> automatically.
<color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> deals <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation DMG</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Sawring - Eradication</color></size>
While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, Chisa casts <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color> in the following 2 ways:
- {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> after casting <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3: Falltone</color>.
- {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> after consuming all <color=Highlight><te href=150803>Ring of Chainsaw</te></color> with <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color> or <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color>.
Attacking targets with <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color> deals <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> and grants Shields to all nearby Resonators in the team for {5}s.
The skill DMG is considered <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation DMG</color>.
Every {6} point of <color=Highlight><te href=150803>Ring of Chainsaw</te></color> consumed by <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color> and <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> increases the DMG Multiplier of the next <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color>. Up to {7} points will be counted toward this effect.
Casting this skill consumes all <color=Highlight><te href=150803>Ring of Chainsaw</te></color> and ends <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Chainsaw Fever</color></size>
While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, <color=Highlight><te href=150804>Lifethread - Jetstream</te></color> is replaced with <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Fever</color>.
<color=Highlight>Chainsaw Fever</color> is at 100% by default.
When Chisa goes on for a period without dealing any damage, <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Fever</color> will rapidly deplete. Once it reaches 0, Chisa enters the <color=Highlight>Burnout State</color> and exits <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>.
While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, Chisa resets <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Fever</color> when dealing damage or when casting Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Moment of Nihility</color>, Intro Skill <color=Highlight>Reverberance - Return</color> and <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz Stage 3: Falltone</color>.
While in the <color=Highlight>Burnout State</color>, <color=Highlight><te href=150803>Ring of Chainsaw</te></color> will rapidly deplete. Once it reaches 0, Chisa exits the <color=Highlight>Burnout State</color>.
When in <color=Highlight>Burnout State</color>, Chisa exits the state upon dealing damage, or casting Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Moment of Nihility</color> and Intro Skill <color=Highlight>Reverberance - Return</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Lifethread - Glide</color></size>
When Chisa is not in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color> and has more than {3} points of <color=Highlight><te href=150804>Lifethread - Jetstream</te></color>, she can consume {8} points of <color=Highlight><te href=150804>Lifethread - Jetstream</te></color> to cast <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Glide</color> in the following 5 ways:
- {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> in mid-air before landing after casting <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack</color>.
- While in mid-air, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> before landing after casting Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Eye of Unraveling</color> or <color=Highlight>Rending Lunge</color>.
- <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> forward shortly after casting <color=Highlight>Thread Withdrawn</color>.
- {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> before landing when launched into mid-air.
- {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> before landing after casting <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Glide</color>.
Casting this skill can pull in nearby enemies marked by <color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color>.
During the skill, hold <color=Highlight>Dodge</color> to glide a short distance on the weapon.
Can trigger successful Dodges within a certain time after casting this skill.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Ring of Chainsaw</color></size>
Chisa can hold up to {9} points of <color=Highlight>Ring of Chainsaw</color>.
Hitting a target with <color=Highlight>Normal Attack </color> and Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Eye of Unraveling</color> grants <color=Highlight>Ring of Chainsaw</color>.
Casting Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Moment of Nihility</color> grants {10} points of <color=Highlight>Ring of Chainsaw</color>.
Casting Intro Skill <color=Highlight>Reverberance - Return</color> grants {11} points of <color=Highlight>Ring of Chainsaw</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Lifethread - Jetstream</color></size>
Chisa can hold up to {12} points of <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Jetstream</color>. 
Chisa continuously obtains <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Jetstream</color> over time.
Chisa obtains {13} points of <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Jetstream</color> upon defeating a target. 
Exiting <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color> resets <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Jetstream</color> to the max limit.
Chisa cannot obtain <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Jetstream</color> passively for a short period of time after casting  <color=Highlight>Lifethread - Glide</color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Forte Gauge</color></size>
Chisa obtains <color=Highlight>Forte Gauge</color> when not in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>.
Chisa consumes <color=Highlight>Forte Gauge</color> to cast <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode Basic Attack</color>. The more <color=Highlight>Forte Gauge</color> consumed, the higher DMG the next <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode Finisher Attack</color> deals.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Thread of Bane</color></size>
Ignore some of the marked targets' DEF when dealing damage.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Chainsaw Mode</color></size>
While in <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>, <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode Basic Attack</color> and <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode Finisher Attack</color> become available.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Chainsaw Mode Basic Attack</color></size>
Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>, considered <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation DMG</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Chainsaw Mode Finisher Attack</color></size>
Deal a massive amount of <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> (considered <color=Highlight>Resonance Liberation DMG</color>) and grant Shields to all nearby Resonators in the team. 
Casting this skill ends <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode</color>.

29-5.Name: Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter Hold DMG

31.Name: Bonus DMG Multiplier per Ring of Chainsaw

Skill.Name: Unraveling - Law Zero
Skill.Desc:
Grant <color=Highlight>Resonant Thread of Closure</color> to all nearby Resonators in the team for {0}s.
While in <color=Highlight>Resonant Thread of Closure</color>:
- When an attack hits, increase the max stacks of <color=Highlight><te href=850180>Negative Status</te></color> and <color=Highlight><te href=150806>Electro Rage</te></color> the target can receive by {1} for {2}s. Unstackable.
- Inflicting <color=Highlight><te href=850180>Negative Status</te></color> or dealing <color=Highlight><te href=150811>Negative Status DMG</te></color> grants <color=Highlight><te href=150802>Thread of Bane</te></color> for {3}s.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
All Resonators in the nearby team obtain the following effects:
- When an attack hits, increase the max stacks of <color=Highlight>Negative Status</color> and <color=Highlight>Electro Rage</color> the target can receive.
- Inflicting <color=Highlight>Negative Status</color> or dealing <color=Highlight>Negative Status DMG</color> grants <color=Highlight>Thread of Bane</color>.
<size=10></size>
<size=40><color=Title>Thread of Bane</color></size>
Ignore some of the marked targets' DEF when dealing damage.

Skill.Name: Tune Break: Broadblade
Skill.Desc: When the target's <color=Highlight>Off-Tune Level</color> is full. Deal <color=Highlight><te href=100001>Tune Break</te></color> DMG.
Skill.SimpleDesc: When the target's <color=Highlight>Off-Tune Level</color> is full

1.Name: Wandering Through the Desolate Corridors
1.Desc:
Chisa is immune to interruption during <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color>,  <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color>, and <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color>

Inflicting <color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color> grants the following additional effects:
- Chisa's ATK is increased by {0} for {1}s.
- Deal fixed {2} points of <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. The target's HP can be reduced to {3} at most and each target can take this damage only once. This instance of damage is considered Basic Attack DMG that does not bear any effect from damage bonuses.

2.Name: Into the Web of Endless Bonds
2.Desc:
Ignore {0} of the target's Havoc RES when dealing damage.
Nearby Resonators in the team with <color=Highlight><te href=150802>Thread of Bane</te></color> gain {1} All-Attribute DMG Bonus.

3.Name: Across the Confusion of the Long Night
3.Desc:
The DMG Multipliers of <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color>, <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> and <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color> are increased by {0}. This effect is mutually stackable with that of <color=Highlight>Woven Myriad - Convergence</color>.
The bonus DMG Multiplier for <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color> granted by <color=Highlight>Sawring- Blitz</color> and <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> when <color=Highlight><te href=150803>Ring of Chainsaw</te></color> is consumed is increased by {1}. This effect is mutually stackable with that of <color=Highlight>Woven Myriad - Convergence</color>.
The Vibration Strength Reduction Rate of <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color>, <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color> and <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color> is increased by {2}.

4.Name: Severing the Endless Cycle of Tragic Fate
4.Desc:
The effect of <color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color> becomes:
When targets marked by <color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color> take direct damage from Resonators, Chisa inflicts <SapTag=0>{0}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=stack P=stacks SapTag=0} of <color=Highlight><te href=850012>Havoc Bane</te></color> on them. This effect is triggered up to once every {1}s.

5.Name: Thousands of Lights to Guide the Way Home
5.Desc:
Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Moment of Nihility</color> gains {0} DMG Bonus.
<color=Highlight>Lifethread - Glide</color> costs {1} less <color=Highlight><te href=150804>Lifethread - Jetstream</te></color>.

6.Name: Thus, Hope is Rekindled with the Rising Dawn
6.Desc:
When Chisa takes a fatal blow during <color=Highlight>Sawring - Blitz</color>, <color=Highlight>Sawring - Eradication</color>, and <color=Highlight>Chainsaw Mode - Dodge Counter</color>, she will remain standing with at least 1 HP.

<color=Highlight><te href=150801>Unseen Snare</te></color> becomes <color=Highlight>Unseen Snare - Finality</color>, which has the following effects:
- <color=Highlight>Unseen Snare - Finality</color> has all the effects of <color=Highlight>Unseen Snare</color>.
- Targets affected by <color=Highlight>Unseen Snare - Finality</color> takes {0} Amplified DMG from Negative Statuses.
- Targets affected by <color=Highlight>Unseen Snare - Finality</color> takes {1} increased DMG from Chisa.

81001508.Name: Chisa
81001508.BgDescription:
An old Startorch Academy uniform, rarely seen these days, but Chisa still wears it out of habit.

This uniform has witnessed her sever countless threads, and up until now, its collar is still crisp and pleats still neat, quietly accompanying her toward a morning that will no longer repeat.
